content.question: A piece of rubber tubing maintains a cylindrical shape as it is stretched. At the instant that the inner radius of the tube is 2 millimeters and the height is 20 millimeters, the inner radius is decreasing at the rate of 0.1 millimeter per second and the height is increasing at the rate of 3 millimeters per second. Which of the following statements about the volume of the tube is true at this instant? (The volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of a cylinder with radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="V equals, pi, r squared, h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.)

choices.label: The volume is increasing by <math alttext="4 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic millimeters per second.
The volume is decreasing by <math alttext="4 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic millimeters per second.
The volume is increasing by <math alttext="20 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic millimeters per second.
The volume is decreasing by <math alttext="20 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic millimeters per second.

content.answer: The volume is increasing by <math alttext="4 pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> cubic millimeters per second.
